definition: to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: To solve these problems, I would like to return the printer and get a refund.
sentences.chinese: 爲了解決這些問題，我打算把貨退還並要求退錢。

sentences.english: A simple carbon tax or a cap-and-rebate program would have been better.
sentences.chinese: 簡單的碳稅或是限制退還項目將會更好。

sentences.english: All applications will be placed in our Talent Pool and handled with strictest confidence, non-returnable.
sentences.chinese: 所有簡歷均會存入集團人才庫，保密處理，恕不退還。

sentences.english: The refund hereby refers to the tuition, not including the registration fee.
sentences.chinese: 此處所指退費僅限學費，報名費恕不退還。

sentences.english: All deposits for holiday cottages are refundable.
A man of the state of Zheng bought the casket but gave back the pearls.
sentences.chinese: 鄭國人只買了他的匣子，而退還了他的珍珠。

sentences.english: Bartering is not uncommon. The gowns are not returnable.
sentences.chinese: 那些婚紗都是不退還的。

sentences.english: All submitted works and information are non-returnable.
sentences.chinese: 參賽作品及提交的一切相關資料概不退還。

sentences.english: Sixth, like the second party changes for some reason, the first party does not return the rent.
sentences.chinese: 如乙方因故變動，甲方不退還租金。

sentences.english: All promotional products are non-refundable and non-exchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 優惠產品一律不可退還或交換。

sentences.english: Course fee paid are not refundable, except in the event of a course being over-subscribed or cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 除課程已額滿或被取消外，一切已繳學費，概不退還。

sentences.english: We agree to refund the VTC any over-payment of training grant.
sentences.chinese: 本公司同意退還職業訓練局多付的訓練津貼。

sentences.english: It should be returned if supplier is not chosen for the project.
sentences.chinese: 如果供應者爲計畫沒被選擇，資訊科技應該被退還。

definition: to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
to demand payment of money owing
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to become invalid/to cancel/to delete/to nullify
